awd_titl_txt: REU SITE: ASSET: Research Experiences for Undergraduates in Advanced Secured Sensor Enabling Technologies
awd_abstract_narration:
This renewal of a Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site at Florida International University focuses on research in secured sensor technologies. The theme presents an opportunity for undergraduates to participate in research with broad impact in mobile health, vehicle platooning, cybersecurity, mobile crowd-sensing, and data analytics. Through firsthand-experience in an interdisciplinary, collaborative environment, students will participate in scientific research through focused activities, building research skills and knowledge on innovative, emerging technologies. Planned activities foster collaborative communication among participants, enhance their research skills, promote learning, and provide motivation to consider research careers. 

Undergraduates will work with research faculty to explore new technologies and solutions utilizing wireless sensor networks (WSN), as well as software/hardware solutions essential to the advancement and practical application of new technologies. The research includes a range of projects, including privacy-preserving blockchain for WSN, information-centric networking with augmented reality, security and privacy for flying ad-hoc networks, trusted crowdsourcing schemes in mobile sensor networks, and Li-FI sensor networks. Diverse groups of undergraduates will explore these topics to better prepare them for graduate studies, ultimately building human capacity while increasing workforce diversity. Additional broader impacts include providing scientific/cross-cultural experiences to members of underrepresented undergraduate groups, including minorities, women, and persons with disabilities

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This award signified the renewal of our Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site, focusing on secured sensor technologies at Florida International University. Undergraduate participants collaborated with faculty on research endeavors, delving into novel technologies and solutions encompassing wireless sensor networking, as well as critical software and hardware components crucial for the advancement and practical implementation of emerging technologies in the field.

Our research theme encompassed a diverse array of projects, including wireless sensor network security, the enhancement of privacy and security within sensor networks, the development of local computation algorithms, advancements in mobile robotics, and the evolution of self-configuring non-cooperative mobile sensors. These research initiatives provide a fundamental opportunity for undergraduates to engage in research endeavors that harmonize intellectual merit with technical innovation, promising broad-reaching impacts, notably in fields such as healthcare, homeland security, and transportation.

The primary objective of our program was to nurture and guide students toward careers in computer and communications research. This objective was achieved through an immersive, interdisciplinary, and collaborative research environment. Participants had the opportunity to engage in a comprehensive scientific research program, complete with well-structured and focused activities designed to bolster their research skills and expand their knowledge in emerging technologies. Effective student-faculty and student-student communication were integral components of our program, accelerating skill development and field-specific learning.

Furthermore, our program aspired to ignite a lasting interest in continued research careers among participants. We anticipate that the successful impact of this project will contribute significantly to the growth of human capacity in computing and communications research and knowledge.

Intellectual Merit: Our project is at the forefront of converging fields, seamlessly uniting sensing, computing, and communications. It spearheads the development of innovative core technologies, supported by cutting-edge methodologies, architectures, and toolkits. Building upon the foundation of a highly successful undergraduate research experience site, our efforts empower a diverse group of undergraduates to master research techniques and prepare for advanced studies. Our chosen research topics are timely and aligned with emerging trends.

Broader Impact: Our project's overarching goal is to cultivate human capacity in the fields of computing and communications research and knowledge. We are committed to providing an unparalleled scientific and cross-cultural experience to motivated undergraduate students, particularly those from underrepresented backgrounds. Our aim is to influence their choices regarding further education and future careers, instilling the confidence to pursue their aspirations. Through targeted recruiting efforts aimed at underrepresented groups, including women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities, our REU program endeavors to enhance both the size and diversity of the scientific workforce.
